pr_title: Support core metrics for async non-streaming and streaming operations

timeline.message: Support core metrics for async clients
Support core metrics for async clients

timeline.bodyText: What is the motivation for logging the NoOpMetricCollector? What kind of data would it write?
timeline.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText: This is intended for debugging purpose and that's why it's trace
replies.author: zoewangg

timeline.bodyText: Can you move this private method down to the other private methods?
timeline.author: cenedhryn

timeline.bodyText: If we had a second metricPublisher mock and added that to the request override instead of the first one, it'd be a better test IMO.
timeline.author: cenedhryn
cenedhryn

timeline.author: dagnir

timeline.bodyText: does this account for errors that result in no HTTP request being sent?
timeline.author: dagnir

replies.bodyText: It seems there's no way to tell if the cause of the error is http request not being sent or http response not being received. I can update it to not report HTTP_REQUEST_ROUND_TRIP_TIME if there's an error, WDUT?
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Yeah I think that's more reasonable. Having this metric in there if the request didn't get fully sent or we didn't receive a response might be misleading.
replies.author: dagnir
